Class DotCarousel

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • DotCarousel
  • public class DotCarousel
extends greenfoot.Actor
    DotCarousel is a Greenfoot Actor used in the class PopUp. This is set of dots that are used to indicate which slide the user is on. These slides are represented by dots.
    The slide the user is on will be represented by a highlighted dot while the other dots are more transparent. The highlighted dot can be changed.
    Version:
    1 (12/04/2020)
    Author:
    Evan Ng

      Constructor Description
      DotCarousel()
      Main constructor - sets all the variables to default values.
      DotCarousel​(int numberOfSlides, int currentSlide)
      Constructor that takes two ints - for setting the number of dots (slides) and the slide currently displayed.
      DotCarousel​(int numberOfSlides, int currentSlide, int dotDiameter, int borderWidth)
      Constructor that takes four ints - for setting the number of dots (slides), the slide currently displayed and the size of the dots.

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentSlide

        public void setCurrentSlide​(int currentSlide)
        Adjusts the highlighted dot. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number of slides.
        Parameters:
        currentSlide - Which dot is highlighted
